about.name: Michael Hill
about.summary: USAF Veteran with more than 17 years of combined experience (Air Force, NASA & Army), I bring a wealth of IT and engineering experience, leadership, analytical knowledge, attention to detail, a collaborative mindset, conflict resolution and determination to any project, producing quality solutions and products.  I lead a team of ~40 FTEs to develop, test, integrate and sustain software for the Army called Precision Fires Manager (PFM). I provide direction in tasking, product design (UI and SW Architecture) and assist with ensuring the project stays on schedule and budget. I also assist with product interactions/integration efforts to help grow the customer base and ensure project longevity.

projects.name: Precision Fires Manager (PFM)
projects.role: CAP Lead and Software Systems Engineer: FULL Time
projects.description: Precision Fires Manager (PFM) is a Quick Fires Software (QFS) that ingests sensor nominated target locations and refines them to Precision Guided Munition (PGM) quality target locations. It is an integrated application that provides a common access point for sensor and/or user data for detection and/or target lists, maneuver units and organic weapon systems that operate at Forward Operating Bases (FOBs), Tactical Operations Centers (TOCs) and Combat Outposts (COPs) that is designed to connect persistent surveillant systems with smart munitions for the Army.
work: Senior member on a team of 3 CAP Leads
Assist SW Manager and Chief Architect in leading a team of 13 developers and 4 testers
Plan and coordinate software releases for PFM
Create and Prioritize Capability Assessment Packages (CAPs) for releases
Plan, schedule and create tasks for developers and testers on the team
Create and maintain software release documentation (SDD, ICD, SRS, etc.)
Brief status updates to management on CAP & development progress during a release cycle
Lead requirements analysis and schedule management
Provide input and help review PFM-related documentation (STD, STP, PP, FHA, PHA, etc.)
Coordinate changes to project schedule, milestones and documentation
Create and update design models and documentation
Member of SWCCB to assist leadership in assessments of bugs and defects
Key contributor to CAP risk assessment and risk mitigation
Create and maintain weekly project reporting updates to management and other stakeholders
POC for PFM Engineering when coordinating between other internal groups (MA, Cyber, etc.)
accomplishments: Assisted in the implementation and release of the PFM v1.0.0.0 application

Validated and migrated developer code to different enrivonments (dev, test, stage, production)
Coordinated and scheduled NASA application activities
Performed software patching and OS kernel updates
Diagnosed and resolved application, server and certificate vulnerabilities
Designed new RHEL architecture and created UML diagram documentation
Increased application uptime by developing automation for server reboots, post patching activities
Analyzed database queries for reports and issues within the applications
Maintained privileges access to servers and applications
SharePoint administration and site design experience
Created and updated documentation for applications, scans, daily tasks, vulnerabilities (POA&Ms) and Root-Cause analyses
Analyzed current application and OS setup for possible architecture improvements

accomplishments: MSFC CIO Achiever Award for the implementation of EZMax Mobile
MSFC Group Achievement Award for the EZMax Mobile Team

projects.name: NISM: Report Audit Tracking
projects.description: This module was created to provide advanced reporting and scheduling capabilities, to the user, that worked in conjunction with the included reporting application.

projects.name: NISM: Heartbeat Oversight Form
projects.description: This module, in the NISM application, was created to track the health of the servers and NISM processes running on the servers. It then stores that data and sends a notification to the development team when performance anomalies are encountered.
